title: I05-5003

sentences.text: The task of machine translation -LRB- MT -RRB- evaluation is closely related to the task of sentence-level semantic equivalence classification .
This paper investigates the utility of applying standard MT evaluation methods -LRB- BLEU , NIST , WER and PER -RRB- to building classifiers to predict semantic equivalence and entailment .
We also introduce a novel classification method based on PER which leverages part of speech information of the words contributing to the word matches and non-matches in the sentence .
Our results show that MT evaluation techniques are able to produce useful features for paraphrase classification and to a lesser extent entailment .
Our technique gives a substantial improvement in paraphrase classification accuracy over all of the other models used in the experiments .

Entity-our_result_show_that_mt_evaluatio.label: Our results show that MT evaluation techniques are able to produce useful features for paraphrase classification and to a lesser extent entailment
aliases: Our results show that MT evaluation techniques are able to produce useful features for paraphrase classification and to a lesser extent entailment
Entity-our_result_show_that_mt_evaluatio.description: The findings on the utility of applying standard machine translation evaluation methods in building classifiers to predict semantic equivalence, paraphrasing, and entailment.

mentions.local_name: Our results show that MT evaluation techniques are able to produce useful features for paraphrase classification and to a lesser extent entailment

summary: The task of machine translation -LRB- MT -RRB- evaluation is closely related to the task of sentence-level semantic equivalence classification . This paper investigates the utility of applying standard MT evaluation methods -LRB- BLEU , NIST , WER and PER -RRB- to building classifiers to predict semantic equivalence and entailment . We also introduce a novel classification method based on PER which leverages part of speech information of the words contributing to the word matches and non-matches in the sentence . Our results show that MT evaluation techniques are able to produce useful features for paraphrase classification and to a lesser extent entailment . Our technique gives a substantial improvement in paraphrase classification accuracy over all of the other models used in the experiments .

Predicate-is_closely_related_to.label: is closely related to
Predicate-is_closely_related_to.description: Indicates a connection between two concepts or tasks that share common goals, objectives, methods, or underlying principles. The predicate suggests a strong association or similarity in nature, purpose, or scope.

Predicate-uses.label: uses
Predicate-uses.description: The predicate 'uses' indicates a relationship between the subject (a system or process) and object(s), where the subject employs or relies on one or more objects to achieve its purpose, measure performance, evaluate quality, or accomplish some other goal.

Predicate-leverages.label: leverages
Predicate-leverages.description: The predicate 'leverages' indicates that the subject exploits or utilizes the object's characteristics, properties, or resources to achieve a particular goal or outcome.

Predicate-produce_useful_features_for.label: produce useful features for
Predicate-produce_useful_features_for.description: The predicate 'produce useful features for' indicates a relationship where the subject (a method or technique) generates characteristics that are beneficial and relevant to the object (an application, task, or domain). This connection implies that the subject's outputs or outcomes have practical value and can be leveraged in some way to improve performance, accuracy, or understanding within the context of the object.

Predicate-improvement_in.label: improvement in
Predicate-improvement_in.description: The predicate 'improvement in' indicates a relationship where the subject has achieved or demonstrated an increase or enhancement in some aspect or quality represented by the object. This connection suggests that the subject's performance, ability, or outcome has been enhanced or improved upon.

Predicate-over.label: over
Predicate-over.description: The predicate 'over' indicates a relationship where the subject has dominance or superiority over the object. It suggests that the subject is above, beyond, or transcends the object in some way.

Predicate-are_able_to_produce.label: are able to produce
Predicate-are_able_to_produce.description: The predicate 'are able to produce' indicates the subject's capacity or capability of generating, creating, or yielding something (the object). It suggests that the subject has a certain level of proficiency, skill, or ability to bring forth or manufacture the specified outcome.

Predicate-apply.label: apply
Predicate-apply.description: The predicate 'apply' indicates that a concept or method (subject) is used to perform an action or operation on something else (object), resulting in a specific outcome, evaluation, or assessment.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject (a person or entity) possesses or encompasses a more general concept or category to which it belongs, as denoted by the object.
